docs.snippet: Last week's foreign exchange market was less erratic in its movement than the preceding week, and at the close there was a mixture of advances and declines, none of which were large in any instance.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last week's foreign exchange market was less erratic in its movement than the preceding week, and at the close there was a mixture of advances and declines, none of which were large in any instance.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED SEPT. 28, 1935.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 1. -- The United States in August increased its exports to all regions except South America, Asia and Oceania, as compared with the corresponding month of last year, the Commerce Department's monthly survey, issued today, showed.

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Oct. 10. -- Fifty-one governments representing four-fifths of mankind joined today through the League of Nations Assembly here in a verdict that "the Italian Government has resorted to war in disregard of its covenants under Article XII of...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Oct. 10. -- Fifty-one governments representing four-fifths of mankind joined today through the League of Nations Assembly here in a verdict that "the Italian Government has resorted to war in disregard of its covenants under Article XII of the League's covenant."
docs.abstract: s at League Assembly meeting which condemned Italy as aggressor

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 12. -- South American members of the League of Nations are hedging on sanctions. They are perfectly willing to give their moral support to League measures as long as it does not cost anything.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 12. -- South American members of the League of Nations are hedging on sanctions. They are perfectly willing to give their moral support to League measures as long as it does not cost anything.
docs.abstract: Statement on Argentine policy on League sanctions against Italy

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICANS EVADE SANCTIONS; All Have Valuable Italian Trade, Which They Expect to Increase in War.
